snippet: When the search was called off, hundreds of relatives and local residents protested at the scene of the accident, forcing the authorities to continue to look for bodies.
abstract: Rescuers recover 54 bodies from ferry that sank in river during storm in central Bangladesh, resuming their search after protests by relatives of people missing in disaster; 12 people are believed to be still unaccounted for.
lead_paragraph: When the search was called off, hundreds of relatives and local residents protested at the scene of the accident, forcing the authorities to continue to look for bodies.

headline.main: 54 Bodies Are Recovered After River Ferry Sinks During a Storm in Bangladesh
headline.print_headline: 54 Bodies Are Recovered After River Ferry Sinks During a Storm in Bangladesh
